get.description:
Retrieve a detailed daily weather forecast

 **Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:weather:*`,`sites:weather:forecast`

 ### Specifying the Location
Weather forecasts can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both.

If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

<!-- theme: warning-->
> Parameters `coordinates` and `@address` are mutually exclusive. Passing more than one will result in an error 

### Units
By default, data is returned in Imperial units. To return data in Metric units, pass the `metric` query parameter and set it to _true_. 

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: Get the weather forecast for the specified lat/lon position

parameters.name: @address
parameters.description: Get the weather forecast for the specified address ID

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The number of forecast outlook days to return

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: Return the results with metric units instead of imperial units

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language in which search results should be returned. Should be one of supported IETF language tags, case insensitive.

error.console: Specify either coordinates or an address ID
The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 could not be found in the database
Parameters coordinates and address are mutually exclusive. Specify only one.
The address ID 8ac7d5dc-803d-40ac-bc37-16c0dbffe5d8 is not geocoded and we have no coordinates to check

get.description:
Retrieve detailed current weather conditions

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:weather:*`,`sites:weather:currently`

### Specifying the Location
Weather conditions can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both.

If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

<!-- theme: warning-->
> _Parameters `coordinates` and `@address` are mutually exclusive. Passing more than one will result in an error_

### Units
By default, data is returned in Imperial units. To return data in Metric units, pass the `metric` query parameter and set it to _true_. 

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: Get the current conditions for the specified lat/lon position

parameters.name: @address
parameters.description: Get the current conditions for the specified address ID

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: Return the results with metric units instead of imperial units

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language in which search results should be returned. Should be one of supported IETF language tags, case insensitive.

areas.name: North Coast
areas.summary: High Surf Advisory in effect from 10:00 PM PST until Wednesday, 10:00 PM PST.  Source: U.S. National Weather Service
areas.details:
...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM
PST WEDNESDAY...

* WHAT...Large breaking waves of 18 to 21 feet expected in the
  surf zone.

* WHERE...North Coast and Central Coast.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous conditions along the coast and in the surf
  zone. Localized beach erosion may also occur due to large waves.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Large waves may break and run up beaches farther than usual. Keep
your distance from the coastline and never turn your back on the
ocean.

Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to
dangerous surf conditions.

&&

get.description:
Retrieve current severe weather alerts and advisories

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:weather:*`,`sites:weather:alerts`
* Licensed Feature: `weather_alerts`

### Specifying the Location
Weather alerts and advisories can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `address` query parameters must be passed, but not both.

If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

<!-- theme: warning-->
> _Parameters `coordinates` and `address` are mutually exclusive. Passing more than one will result in an error_

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code.

<!-- theme: warning-->
> _The API supports any valid IETF language code but alert data may not be available in the specified language_

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: Get weather alerts for the specified lat/lon position

parameters.name: @address
parameters.description: Get weather alerts for the specified address ID

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language in which search results should be returned. Should be one of supported IETF language tags, case insensitive.

get.description:
Get activity indices and recommendations based on current weather conditions

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`sites:*`,`sites:weather:*`,`sites:weather:currently`

### Specifying the Location
Weather indices can be obtained for a specified set of coordinates or by specifying a geocoded address object ID. Either the `coordinates` or `@address` query parameters must be passed, but not both.

If the specified address ID has not been geocoded, an error will be returned.

<!-- theme: warning-->
> _Parameters `coordinates` and `@address` are mutually exclusive. Passing more than one will result in an error_

### Language
By default, data is returned in English. To return data in another language, pass the `langugage` query parameter and set it to a valid IETF language code

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: Get weather indices for the specified lat/lon position

parameters.name: @address
parameters.description: Get weather indices for the specified address ID

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language in which search results should be returned. Should be one of supported IETF language tags, case insensitive.
